candidates.name: Margaret Miles
candidates.why_elect: I was a North Shore City Councillor for 15 years prior to being a Local board member for 9 years. I have the ability to evaluate financial documents and work well with my fellow elected members to achieve results. I have lived in Upper Harbour for over 35 years.
candidates.why_stand: Having been an elected member for many years I have a strong awareness of local issues and I am willing to continue to listen and advocate for residents and communities.

candidates.name: Glen Stanton
candidates.why_elect: I have lived on the North Shore for more than 50 years so am very familiar with the area. Previously a Sales Director I now work part time as a Driver for both Knightsbridge and Mayfair Villages so am used to working with Seniors and understanding their needs.
candidates.why_stand: I will do my best to represent every constituent in Upper Harbour. However, I am aware that there are many Retirement Villages in the area and my special focus will be to give these residents a voice. If elected my pledge is to take their concerns before Council.

candidates.name: Lisa Whyte
candidates.why_elect: I have proudly represented this community in an elected position for 15 years. I have lived in other countries and communities, and use that experience to inform my decision making. If I can help with an issue I will, and if I can't I will be honest and say so.
candidates.why_stand: Upper Harbour is a great place to live, work and play. We must maintain what we care about and build for our growing and diversifying community. I have skills and experience that make me an effective community leader who gets results. Decisions made today affect the next generation.

candidates.name: Anna Atkinson
candidates.why_elect: I am a chartered accountant with 20 years experience in business. I will use my experience to ensure rates are spent effectively, efficiently and with accountability. I will provide fresh eyes to the local board as it seeks to meet the challenges of the future.
candidates.why_stand: I love where we live. I love the parks, the open spaces and the culture. I want the Local Board to protect the way of life we cherish and develop it in a sustainable way that benefits our community.

candidates.name: Uzra Casuri-Balouch
candidates.why_elect: I approach this role with an attitude of serving you. I am a Justice of Peace with 17 years experience in governance roles. I am a prudent financial manager who actively seeks your views and preferences when making decisions and proud of accountable for each one made on your behalf.
candidates.why_stand: I am standing for re-election to UHL Board because like you I call this place my home and I love it. I have worked very hard to connect with you and make a difference and I will continue to be accessible and available if given the opportunity to serve again.

candidates.name: Callum Blair
candidates.why_elect: Have served the area as an elected representative previously and have the knowledge and expertise to push Upper Harbour issues to council's attention for addressing.
candidates.why_stand: As a previous city councillor and local board member I am concerned at the reduced funding by council to the Upper Harbour. This needs addressing urgently.

candidates.name: Jaggar Bootten
candidates.why_elect: I am currently an elected member of the St John West Auckland Area Committee, board member of Cystic Fibrosis New Zealand and a medical student. On the Upper Harbour Local Board, I am very committed to listening, learning, and working with you to advocate on your behalf throughout my term.
candidates.why_stand: I am passionate about the challenges we face as a community. Throughout my life, I have dedicated my time to roles focused on helping other people. It concerns me that the local board lacks the passion and energy to drive meaningful change.

candidates.name: John Henry Glover
candidates.why_elect: I have a solid moral compass, understand budgets, and have strong ethics. I have a wealth experience in communications with a diverse range of people in the construction industry as a project manager. Upper Harbour is my home, so I know the landscape, community, and embrace our future.
candidates.why_stand: I decided to stand after a board meeting when I witnessed my neighbour struggle with getting sign off from the local board to complete a footpath on Gills Road, the road I grew up on. There is a real need to be an advocate for residents safety, wellbeing, and security.

candidates.name: Nicholas Mayne
candidates.why_elect: I am seeking re-election after my first term on the Local Board. I feel I have been successful in achieving a lot of what I campaigned on, in the last election; but more importantly I have learnt a lot that I want to apply to the next term.
candidates.why_stand: Upper Harbour is my backyard. I grew up here, and I am raising my kids here. As such I have seen it change over time. I want to continue to advocate, to ensure this change enhances the lives of people and the environment; while preserving the best of our heritage.

candidates.name: Jonathan Mcdonald
candidates.why_elect: I Have lived in Upper Harbour for over 25 years. I know the people, I know the places, I know the problems and I know how great it is to live here. I've run small businesses, I've been involved in leadership of community organisations both locally and nationally.
candidates.why_stand: I dislike when people say "someone should do something about X" and pass off problems as not their responsibility. I would rather solve problems than complain about them. I'm running for the Upper Harbour Local Board because I don't want to sit around and watch problems get ignored.
